cells

Class StartingCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • cells.StartingCell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cell

    public class StartingCell
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cell
    Class which defines the starting cell of a game, the starting cell has 0 for index, and it is where all the players start the game.
    Author:
    ostrowst

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StartingCell(java.util.ArrayList<Player> ap)
      Constructor of the StartingCell that creates a StartingCell and initializes the cell with a list of players.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canBeLeftNow()
      Indicates if a player occupying this cell can, at this turn, leave the cell.
      int getIndex()
      Gives the value of the index of the StartingCell.
      Player getPlayer()
      Returns the player currently occupying this cell, null if none.
      int handleMove(int diceThrow)
      Returns the index of the cell really reached by a player when he reaches this cell.
      boolean isBusy()
      Indicates if a player currently occupies this cell.
      boolean isRetaining()
      Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell.
      void welcome(Player player)
      Remembers player to be in this cell.

      • canBeLeftNow

        public boolean canBeLeftNow()
        Indicates if a player occupying this cell can, at this turn, leave the cell.
        Specified by:
        canBeLeftNow in interface Cell
        Returns:
        true if and only if the player in the cell can freely leaves the cell at this turn.

      • isRetaining

        public boolean isRetaining()
        Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell.
        Specified by:
        isRetaining in interface Cell
        Returns:
        true if and only if the only way for a player to get out of this cell is for another player to replace him.

      • handleMove

        public int handleMove(int diceThrow)
        Returns the index of the cell really reached by a player when he reaches this cell. For a NormalCell, the returned value is equals to getIndex()
        Specified by:
        handleMove in interface Cell
        Parameters:
        diceThrow - The result of the dice when the player reaches this cell.
        Returns:
        the index of the cell effectively reached when a player reaches this cell after the given throw of dice
